last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>134391695
I feel like both Pepe and Feef should have a lot more potential than they're actually utilized with. There's plenty of comedy to mine out of an oblivious, stalkerish rom com "protagonist" who can't read a room and overly romanticizes their own infatuated delusions while simultaneously refusing to actually communicate with their prospective partners. Pepe definitely did it better, even though the tropes surrounding a forceful leading man who 'reads between the lines' are pretty outdated, but yeah Fifi really didn't land at all unless the only deliberate motive writers had was "subtle" fetish fuel.

I think the problem, especially with Fifi, is they want to also endear her to audiences and make her "likable" even though the crux of her character should really emphasize on how inherently repulsive she is, and how backhandedly selfish her idea of romance is. We shouldn't envy the boys she's chasing; we should feel sorry for them, and rooting for them to do better. Fifi's a clingy, myopic freak who stinks like a landfill and will certainly drag anyone she meets down to her level and never let them leave. She should be somebody content with her own abject poverty because "nothzin matteaurs but h'our loufve", somebody who'd prefer to live in her own little fantasy world and expects people to just play along with it no matter how dissonant the reality is.

>What is this thread?
Every Wins'day at Win-O'-Clock we gather here and post links to the latest scans and rips of comic books.
Most links we uploaded ourselves, others we are sharing from elsewhere.
Some comics we've even purchased ourselves (but most we didn't).
If you'd like to help out, just ask and we would be delighted to tell you how.
Otherwise, be patient, be polite, and understand the simple concept behind these words: Not posted means not available yet.

>Where can I find old Win-O'-Threads?
http://desuarchive.org/co/search/subject/Official%20Win-O'-Thread/
http://boards.fireden.net/co/search/subject/Official%20Win-O'-Thread/
(Note: This finds the OP for old threads. If you want to search for comics in the archive, clear the subject field!)

>Where can I find downloads for other comics?
Warez forums/blogs, DDL-indexing search engines (like FilesLoop), torrent trackers (like 1337x) and other P2P networks (like DC++).
If a link has been posted on 4chan, you can search for it in the Desu archive (add "http*" to searches to return only posts with links).
If all else fails, just >buy it.

>Where can I buy comics?
http://www.amazon.com/
On the various publishers' webstores, and at your local comics shop.

>Where can I find an LCS?
http://www.comicshoplocator.com/

>Where can I find out when new comics are released?
http://www.comiclist.com/index.php
http://www.previewsworld.com

>How do I download from websites that only give me .exe files?
Untick the checkbox under the download button.

>How can I find this thread every week?
If you are using the inline extension go to http://4chan.org/co/official or use the option under "Filters & Post Hiding".
If you have 4chanX go to Settings > Filter > Subject and add the following line:
/Official Win-O'-Thread/;highlight

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>134391504
Most the concepts tend to just kind of be "extra long episode" and their fanbases have different thresholds for what they want to see. I might be a big enough fan of Hey Arnold to watch it when it's on, but not to want to see it in theaters. Similarly parents might just say "we have Penguins of Madagascar at home" why waste your money seeing what you probably wanted to avoid anyways?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>134391850
Additionally unless the studio has the funds to hire out more employees to produce the movie, then a lot of time production is incredibly slow or they have to cut quality on the main show all together to keep a schedule.

So while the Bob's Burgers movie wasn't bad, it always came out a couple years later than I think is the prime time to do so. Unlike the Simpsons which effectively could have been made at any point, many shows would benefit more from a show in the 3rd or 4th season of airing, but that's not really feasible for many shows to try and attempt as that early on there isn't enough trust in the show by the studios to want to invest in the product more than they already are.

threads.com:
Stargaze is a /co/ collaborative space where anons pitch concepts, write episodes, and draw production art for the greatest toy commercial animated series that never was (but everyone still remembers) : Stargaze and the Sentinels of Starlight!

>The story thus far
Star-ro, Prince of the cracked planet Astray, wields the Royal Blaster (a relic of immeasurable power containing the last shard of the Lightstar) against the forces of evil as the Hero Stargaze!

Alongside him in this noble fight against the fearsome creature of the void Nebillious and all agents of evil in the galaxy are a wide cast of friends and comrades, the Sentinels of Starlight.
Chief among them
>Conshock
the cloven hoofed psychic pugilist
>Usra-La
The beautiful yet hot tempered Bar-Barean shaman warrior
>Rock-it
the fearsome yet kind hearted veteran of the Geosphere
>Lanstar
The cocksure and tech savvy friend of Star-ro
>Comet
The half Baastanian half sister of Star-ro, always causing mischief

Along with the cerebral Trancia, illustrious Pum-mel, fearsome Krogdar, shifty Shang-Xu, packrat scrapper Tonns, warrior of the shadows Jet-Hawk, honorable Hammer Hex, the incredible Robo-Puppy, and many more!

Fighting the villainous legions of the Astrayan traitor Warmaster, the voracious Hogmaw, the rogue robotic AI Wireshark, the seductive insect queen Cicadre and her manipulative assassin Scorpionic, the metal-eating Jaw-breaker, the mysterious and vicious technomancer Sigil, and the master of evil himself: The Nefarious Nebullious!
Creature of terror, the void made form with the dastardly ability to SUMMON SEVERAL HUNDRED SMOKE SNAKES! Enemy of all who wish for peace in the lightstar galaxy. He seeks the Royal Blaster and should he get it cosmos will never be the same!

Last thread: https://desuarchive.org/co/thread/134049654/#134049654
Do your part in this fight against the evil of declining toy sales!
See you....OUT THERE!

We put it on the back burner because someone suggested we were getting too focused on the political and baastanian stuff.
>>134389970
Yeah, we don't have a full story yet so we don't have a full idea of how it's going to go.

>one where there's a happy family for some time before the kidnapping of Momet.
I was the one who had that in mind, but I think I might be the only one who thought that. I guess since it's all going to be off screen, having Comet grow up in a happy nuclear family before the series begins isn't actually important. It's the 80s and she's a kid, we don't need to make a reason for her to be bubbly and optimistic.

Basically I think we need to decide on the order of major story beats of the Momet plot, and what the Baastanian and Tamautian reactions are to each would be. Also we should make a decision on what exactly the relationship between Astray and Tamau was before Penumbra and Momet got together.
-Penumba and Momet fall in love
-Penumbra and Momet marry
-Penumbra and Momet have Comet together
-Nebulious gets involved with Baastanian affairs in some way
-Some Tamautians get involved with attacking the Astray homeworld
-Momet winds up imprisoned/kidnapped

And tentative story beat, I suggested the idea that at the end of the Nebulious arc, Momet would be held prisoner on one of his dark ships (and the bad guys do the dramatic villainous move where they try to make the heroes choose between saving Trancia and saving Momet), but I think her initial imprisonment would be on Tamau, so if that happens it would mean at some point she is either stolen from her Baastanian captors or there is some kind of deal.
That last one might just not happen, free to just nix my ideas if you're all against them anyway. I'm not the boss.
I wrote them down in the order I imagined them happening, but maybe there are better ideas.
(cont.)

Is the idea supposed to be that Momet is taken hostage on Tamau at around the same time that Astray was attacked?

>>134390065
>I was under the impression that the Bastaanians/tamautians did not approve of the marriage and the fact they made a filthy half breed. Since they are very isolationist and nationalistic. If it was just a group of terrorists who did it they'd have no reason not to just go and save her, after all.
>Maybe the middle ground is that it was a political marriage, but then a coup took over shortly afterwards and they forbid the relationship leading to Momet's imprisonment.

I thought for a while we were going with the idea that there was tensions between two factions on the planet.
One that was in favor of the alliance with Penumbra, and probably are still disgusted by the half-breed child, but live with it for the sake of their planet's prosperity, the half-breed is always off the planet anyway.
And then the second faction hates it all, they may not be Nebulious-evil but they don't want Astray getting involved with them, and would bully Penumbra and any Astrayans they think they can get away with messing with. I think most of this faction just wants to stay isolationist, because if they wanted outright war with Astray, the only thing stopping them is the fact they would lose for sure.
If Momet is going to be held prisoner on Tamau, then they would probably need to be the ones in power.
Another idea is maybe Momet isn't exactly a prisoner (at least not at first, maybe she gets totally imprisoned later on) but she is staying on Tamau as a way to try to keep tensions down. Maybe some of the hostile ones are placated at first by her staying on Tamau and away from Penumbra, but then get more and more hostile and don't care anymore.

I am one of the few that miss Donald Blake, at least as an origin, serving as the lesson in humility and service Thor needed, a lesson that took years as a hapless, lame mortal.

The second one REALLY disappointed me because they doubled down on the romance and wasted the villain, which was modus operandi at Marvel back then except Natalie Portman couldn't hide her contempt and/or disinterest in the production. I hated the romance and the actress involved in it too.

Third one just emulated Guardians of the Galaxy. Made Thor a simple-minded goof. Introduced that one note actress for Valkryie. And since they can't make Hulk movies, shoehorned him in Thor's movie, allowing us to miss out on Hulk's development by having it happen off screen, the start of a trend that continues today.

The fourth...it seems like Mr Cohen, the director, has no supervision from studios and is given much freedom to run, and he does so very quickly into various walls. It's not very funny while intending to be. The soundtrack can be insufferable. The villain propped the whole thing up. Marvel never made us care about Jane, and so when she dies, we still don't care.

I'd recommend them all, I don't condone skipping episodes and movies in a series. The first for the context and world building, it may be the best directed of them all. The second because although it is by far the worst, pivotal events take place in UT. The third because it seems like it is the closest thing to a Hulk movie we will get. https://www.dictionary.com/browse/fanatical
>What does fanatical mean?
>Fanatical means having and being motivated by an extreme and often unquestioning enthusiasm, devotion, or zeal for something, such as a religion, political stance, or cause.
>A person who shows such extreme enthusiasm or devotion is called a fanatic. Sometimes, fanatic is used negatively to imply that someone takes such devotion too far, as in They’re considered religious fanatics due to their extreme practices. Close synonyms are extremist, radical, and zealot.
>Other times, fanatic is not used negatively but instead simply refers to someone who is extreme in their devotion or enthusiasm for an interest or hobby. For example, calling someone a sports fanatic means they’re an extremely enthusiastic fan of sports. In fact, the word fan is a shortening of fanatic.
